intro: Canthium scabrosum, commonly known as the rough canthium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
